Question: This person was back to writing songs on an upright piano above the Birdland Club in New York City.
Hints: This person later followed with "Cherry, Cherry", "Kentucky Woman", "Thank the Lord for the Night Time", "Do It", and others.
This person then married Marcia Murphey, a production assistant; they also had two children, both sons, Jesse and Micah.
This person eventually triumphed in court, and secured ownership of his Bang-era master recordings in 1977.
